title.bibl: Otthon, Aug. 12, 1934. Sensational Hungarian Airplane Invention

div.bibl: Otthon, Aug. 12, 1934. SENSATIONAL HUNGARIAN AIRPLANE INVENTION

body.p: The mushroom shaped airplane that was tried out successfully at Curtis-Reynolds airport is the invention of Stephen Nemeth, a Chicago-Hungarian engineer.
The machine vies with the wind mill type airplanes. It flies at the rate of 30-40 kilometres an hour, and requires only 15 metres space to land.
The new type airplane is like a huge mushroom, and according to experts, will be the forerunner of cheap week-end air transportation.
